description: Data dictionary for CAD system assignment export containing personnel assignments, squad information, shift status, and vehicle assignments.

fields.description: Full name of the assigned officer including title/prefix (e.g., Capt., Lt., Sgt., P.O., Det., C.O., SPO., HCOP, PEO, CLK), first name, last name, and badge number. Format: '[Prefix] [First Name] [Last Name] [Badge Number]'. Examples: 'Capt. James Smith 158', 'P.O. Robert Carucci 261', 'HCOP Steven Yoon 715'. May contain extra spaces that need normalization.
accepted_formats: Title FirstName LastName BadgeNumber (with potential extra spaces)
fields.derive_rule: Can be parsed into: Prefix (Title), First_Name, Last_Name, Badge_Number, Padded_Badge (4-digit zero-padded), Norm_Name (format: '[First Initial]. [Last Name] #[Padded Badge]')
fields.default_rule: Optional. Blank values indicate no officer assigned. Extra spaces should be normalized. Missing badge numbers result in empty Padded_Badge and Norm_Name fields.

validation.pattern: May contain titles: Capt., Lt., Sgt., P.O., Det., C.O., SPO., HCOP, PEO, CLK, Chief, Const., CIV
validation.notes: Last token may be numeric badge number if present

fields.description: Secondary or backup officer assigned to the same assignment. Format matches Officer field. Typically empty in most records.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Typically blank. If present, follows same format as Officer field.

fields.description: Squad or unit assignment code. Maps to organizational hierarchy (WG1-WG4). Common values: A1-A4, B1-B4 (Patrol Division squads), TRF (Traffic), DET (Detective Bureau), CSB (Crime Suppression Bureau), STA (Station Assignment), SSOCC (Safe Street Operations Control Center), ESU (Emergency Services Unit), REMU (Records and Evidence Management Unit), ADMIN (Administrative - context-dependent), TRN (Training), COMM ENG (Communications), and others.
fields.derive_rule: Maps to organizational hierarchy: WG1 (Division), WG2 (Bureau/Unit), WG3 (Platoon/Office), WG4 (Squad). Special ADMIN assignments require officer-specific override logic.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Blank indicates no squad assignment. ADMIN requires special handling based on officer (e.g., Capt. DeWitt -> Investigations Division, Capt. Weber -> Operations Division, Capt. Zisa -> Administrative Division, Chief Antista -> Chief of Police, Lt. Swetits -> OPS).

validation.notes: Some values may have leading/trailing spaces that need trimming

fields.description: Geographic zone or operational area assignment. May include zone codes, unit designations, or special assignments. Examples: TRAFF (Traffic), Housing, Radio, LT-C (Lieutenant Command), SGT-S (Sergeant South), SGT-N (Sergeant North), SGT-C (Sergeant Central), QLD (Quality of Life Detail), CITY, H1, A3/4 (combined zones), A7/8, A1/2, etc.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Blank indicates no zone assignment. May contain leading/trailing spaces.

validation.notes: Values vary widely and may include special designations, combined zones, or unit codes

fields.description: Unit number assigned to the officer, typically matching their badge number. Numeric value representing the officer's unit identifier. May be used for vehicle/radio assignment correlation.
fields.derive_rule: Typically matches badge number extracted from Officer field. May be used to link to vehicle assignments.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Blank/NaN indicates no unit assignment. Should be integer if present.

fields.description: Vehicle/patrol car number assigned to the officer. Numeric identifier for the specific vehicle assigned. May match Unit number in some cases, but can differ for special assignments or shared vehicles.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Blank/NaN indicates no vehicle assignment. Should be integer if present.

fields.description: Current shift status of the officer. Indicates whether the officer is currently on duty or off duty at the time of the export.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Should be normalized to 'On Duty' or 'Off Duty' if present.

fields.description: Date field representing a one-day offset or calculation date. Appears to be consistently set to the export date minus one day (e.g., if export is 1/5/2026, this field is 1/4/2026). Format: M/D/YYYY.
fields.derive_rule: May be calculated as export date minus 1 day. Used for date range filtering or reporting.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Typically set to export date minus one day. Invalid dates become NaT when parsed.

fields.description: Assignment date or effective date for the officer's current assignment. May represent the date the assignment was established, last updated, or the export date. Format: M/D/YYYY. Values vary widely and may include historical dates.
fields.default_rule: Optional. May be blank. Invalid dates become NaT when parsed. Historical dates are valid (e.g., assignment start dates from 2019-2025).

validation.notes: May contain historical dates representing assignment start dates

fields.description: Weapon assignment or weapon identifier for the officer. Currently appears to be empty/unused in the export, but field exists for potential future use.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Currently appears to be blank/unused in exports. Reserved for future weapon tracking.

organizational_mapping.description: Squad codes map to organizational hierarchy (WG1-WG4) as follows:

A1-A4, B1-B4.WG4: Squad code (A1, A2, A3, A4, B1, B2, B3, B4)

CSB, DET.WG2: Crime Suppression Bureau (CSB) or Detective Bureau (DET)

ESU, REMU, SSOCC, TRF.WG2: Emergency Services Unit (ESU), Records and Evidence Management Unit (REMU), Safe Street Operations Control Center (SSOCC), or Traffic Unit (TRF)

special_cases.Lt. Matthew Swetits 160: Administrative Division / Office of Professional Standards (OPS)

officer_field: May contain extra spaces (e.g., 'HCOP John Squillace  711' has double space before badge)
Some names have compound last names (e.g., 'Mark Del Carpio', 'Felix Carrera')
Some entries may not have badge numbers
Extra spaces should be normalized before parsing
squad_field: ADMIN assignments require special handling based on officer
Some values may be blank or contain only spaces
zone_field: Values are inconsistent (some have spaces, some don't)
Combined zones use slash notation (e.g., A3/4, A7/8)
blank_rows: Export may contain blank rows that should be filtered out
Some rows have only partial data (e.g., only Zone/Squad but no Officer)
